raw_response:
SUMMARY:
The individual's purchase history reveals a strong preference for engaging drama and suspense genres, consistently rating shows and movies highly, predominantly between 4.4 and 5.0. They favor series with intricate plot developments and character depth, as indicated by repeated mentions of addictive and enthralling content. There's a noted appreciation for series that build upon previous episodes, highlighting engagement with ongoing narratives. 

Quality is a priority, as the individual expresses disdain for subpar productions, evidenced by low ratings for unsatisfactory content. However, they exhibit a willingness to explore varying quality levels as long as the storyline remains enticing. Price sensitivity is not overtly emphasized, suggesting a focus on overall value rather than cost. 

Recurring themes involve a blend of action, personal drama, and moral conflicts within storylines—visible across various reviews mentioning video content that includes violence, complex relationships, and emotional stakes, indicating an attraction to more intense and mature themes. 

In summary, this shopper prefers high-quality, well-narrated dramatic and suspenseful content, with a clear inclination towards established series that deliver consistent engagement and character-driven storytelling.

target_interaction.title: Movie was ok
target_interaction.text: The movie was ok, but I never got to see the end.  I ran out of time I guess and then the movie was removed to rent or watch and now it just sits there showing the want to rewatch, but you can't and you can't get it removed.  Technical glitch
description: HD. Mark Wahlberg is a loner cop bent on avenging the murders of his wife and child in this stylish adaptation of the popular video game.
